name: JSON Logger
description: This is the main class of an extension, is the entry point from which configurations, connection providers, operations and sources are going to be declared.

description.value: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.
A scalar time value for the maximum amount of time a dynamic configuration instance should be allowed to be idle before it's considered eligible for expiration
A time unit that qualifies the maxIdleTime attribute

parameters.name: expirationPolicy
parameters.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

displayModel.summary: Name of the Mule application. Recommendation: This value should be based on pom.xml
Version of the Mule application. Recommendation: This value should be based on pom.xml
Name of the Mule Environment where the application is running. Recommendation: This value should be based on external property
Indicate if log entries should be formatted or single line
Indicate if location information should be logged
Indicate if Content fields should be parsed as part of the JSON logger output
Indicate which fields (from JSON output) should be disabled from logging separated by comma. They should match the exact name given in loggerProcessor.json schema

Indicate which fields (inside a content type with JSON output only) should be masked before from logging separated by comma. They can be JSON keys or JSON paths. If empty, no masking will be applied. Recommendation: This value should be based on external property
Message to be logged
NOTE: Writing the entire payload every time across your application can cause serious performance issues
Current processing stage
Logger priority
If not set, by default will log to the org.mule.extension.jsonlogger.JsonLogger category
Indicate which Global config should be associated with this Scope.
If not set, by default will log to the org.mule.extension.jsonlogger.JsonLogger category

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameters.name: targetValue
parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

displayModel.summary: Name of the target queue or exchange destination (e.g. logger-queue, logger-exchange)
The region URL where the Queue resides. Obtain this URL from the Anypoint Platform > MQ
The Client App ID to be used. Obtain this ID from Anypoint Platform > MQ > Client Apps
The Client App Secret for the given Client App ID
Indicate which log categories should be send (e.g. ["my.category","another.category"]). If empty, all will be send.
Indicate max quantity of logs entries to be send to the external destination
Name of the target exchange destination (e.g. logger-exchange)
Indicate which log categories should be send (e.g. ["my.category","another.category"]). If empty, all will be send.
Indicate max quantity of logs entries to be send to the external destination
Name of the target queue destination (e.g. logger-queue)
Indicate which log categories should be send (e.g. ["my.category","another.category"]). If empty, all will be send.
Indicate max quantity of logs entries to be send to the external destination
